com.hippikon.security.crypto
Class DESStringEncryptor

java.lang.Object
  com.hippikon.security.crypto.DESStringEncryptor
public class DESStringEncryptor
extends java.lang.Object

This class provides convenient String DES/CBC encryption/decryption operations using JCE extensions. The current implementation provides a reference for future development on the Security API. Only one SecretKey is used whereas the class should support the ability to use different keys without redeployment.

Context Dependencies

To use this class a JCE DES provider must be installed on the system. This class was developed using the Sun Reference JCE provider. Please read the JCE documentation for JCE installation instructions and configuration. Other providers may be used as per the JCE specification (Cryptix being the most likely candidate).

Since:
JDK 1.2.2
Version:
$Id: DESStringEncryptor.html,v 1.1.1.1 2005/06/20 21:00:55 dalehippikon Exp $
Author:
Dale Churchett

Method Detail

getInstance

public static DESStringEncryptor getInstance()
                                      throws java.lang.Exception
Returns a DESStringEncryptor object to use for DES encryption/decryption. This method will attempt to use a file named key.ser located on the system classpath

Returns:
a DESStringEncryptor object
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - thrown if the object couldn not be instantiated

getInstance

public static DESStringEncryptor getInstance(java.lang.String keyFilename)
                                      throws java.lang.Exception
Returns a DESStringEncryptor object that obtains a SecretKey generated by the DESSecretKeyGenerator utility class and written to a file. The file must be located in the system classpath if the filename is not an absolute path.

Parameters:
keyFilename - a file that stores a SecretKey created by the DESSecretKeyGenerator class
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - thrown if the object couldn not be instantiated

base64Encrypt

public static java.lang.String base64Encrypt(java.lang.String toEncryptAndEncode)
                                      throws java.lang.Exception
Convenience method that encrypts a String and then Base64 encodes to allow clients to handle as ASCII characters.

Parameters:
toEncryptAndEncode - the String to encrypt and base64 encode
Returns:
an encrypted and base64 encoded String. This can be unencoded and decrypted using the base64Decrypt(String base64ToDecrypt) method.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - thrown if the encryption/encoding operation fails

base64Decrypt

public static java.lang.String base64Decrypt(java.lang.String base64ToDecrypt)
                                      throws java.lang.Exception
Convenience method that decrypts a String that is base64 encoded from a byte array that was previously encrypted. Base64 encoding allows the byte array to be handled as ASCII characters.

Parameters:
base64ToDecrypt - a Base64 encoded String
Returns:
the decrypted String
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - thrown if the decryption/unencoding operation fails

encrypt

public byte[] encrypt(java.lang.String toEncrypt)
               throws java.lang.Exception
Returns an encrypted byte array of cipher text generated from the String provided as the method parameter.

Parameters:
toEncrypt - the String to encrypt
Returns:
a byte array containing the encrypted String
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - thrown if the encryption operation could not be performed

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Used for testing only. This method takes a String and then encrypts, Base64 encodes and URLEncodes into a format suitable for storing in a cookie.

A SecretKey file may be passed in as the first command line argument, else the default file will be used
